roleset.name: to close with or as if with a seal

example.name: with a resultative phrase
example.text: One had best not dance on top of a coffin until [the lid]-2 is sealed [*-2] tightly shut . ''

example.name: transitive
example.text: In his haste [*]-1 to seal the deal with Tiger Chairman Saul Steinberg last August , [Mr. Smith]-1 ignored a promise that he had made to his own pilots three years ago : that any fliers acquired [*] in future mergers would be `` end-tailed '' -- put at the bottom of the pilot seniority list that determines work schedules , pay and career options .
example.arg: [ the deal] [ with Tiger Chairman Saul Steinberg]

example.name: inanimate causer
example.text: Demographics-1 converged with `` mainstream '' and demonizing [*-1] to seal Robert Bork 's fate .

predicate.note: Frames file for 'seal' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.
